meanings.definition: To murder (someone) by suffocation so as to leave no marks.
meanings.sent1: The criminal burkes his victim to avoid detection.
meanings.sent2: The killer burkes the victim to cover up the crime.
meanings.sent3: The mystery novel had a plot twist where the murderer burkes the evidence.
meanings.sent4: In the shadows, the assassin burkes his target without a sound.
meanings.sent5: The silence of the night was broken only by the sound of someone being burked.

meanings.definition: To suppress or hide quietly or indirectly.
meanings.sent1: She burkes her feelings to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent2: The government tries to burkes the truth from the public.
meanings.sent3: The student burkes a giggle during the serious lecture.
meanings.sent4: The clouds burkes the sun, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: The secret organization burkes any dissenting voices to maintain control.
